thread.title: Manchester United youngster Axel Tuanzebe reveals why Old Trafford is the perfect place to be
thread.title_full: Manchester United youngster Axel Tuanzebe reveals why Old Trafford is the perfect place to be

author: Liam Corless
title: Manchester United youngster Axel Tuanzebe reveals why Old Trafford is the perfect place to be
text:
Sport Manchester United youngster Axel Tuanzebe reveals why Old Trafford is the perfect place to be Tuanzebe could make his senior debut for the Red Devils on Sunday when Wigan visit in the FA Cup fourth round Share Axel Tuanzebe is close to making his senior debut at Manchester United (Photo: Man Utd via Getty) Share Get   Thank you for subscribing!   
Manchester United starlet Axel Tuanzebe has revealed why he believes Old Trafford is the perfect place for him to be. 
The 19-year-old centre-back is highly rated by United manager Jose Mourinho and was in the travelling squad for Thursday's trip to Hull in the EFL Cup. 
He didn't get on the pitch on that occasion but a first-team debut isn't far away and Tuanzebe says it is in the make-up of the club to give young players opportunities to shine in the senior side. 
"It's a massive boost to see the likes of Marcus (Rashford) and Jesse (Lingard) coming right from the bottom and working all the way up through the system," Tuanzebe told MUTV. "It's always a great thing to see. It gives everyone a boost - if they can do it, why can't I? 
"Massive credit to the club for actually having the belief the youngsters can play for the first team. I don't think that happens at every other club and it's a real positive for all the players working here." Tuanzebe, right, laughs with Paul Pogba in training earlier this week (Photo: Man Utd via Getty) 
The 19-year-old reckons "there's no better feeling" than being a part of the first-team set-up but knows he needs to keep his feet on the ground. 
"I can't let it go to my head and relax now," he said. "I've got to keep my head down and keep proving to him why he should have faith in me. I've got to keep pushing every day and showing why I should be in the team and why I'm here at the club. 
"It's definitely been good training with superstars and I can learn a lot from these players every day. I'm always willing to learn and try my best. It doesn't depend on the level, I could be with the Under-23s or the first team, I always try my best to improve as a player." 
Tuanzebe could make his senior debut for United on Sunday when Wigan, managed by former United reserves coach Warren Joyce, visit the Theatre of Dreams in the FA Cup fourth round. Jose Mourinho is a big fan of the 19-year-old (Photo: John Peters/Manchester United FC) 
"It's down to the manager (to decide whether to give me my debut)," Tuanzebe said. "All I can do is try my best in training every day and show why I can be a first-team player." 
Of Joyce's impact on his career, he added: "He was a massive influence personally. 
"Every day was flat out. There were no rest days, even when the first team were off, we were in doing extra work. During international breaks, we were doing extra. 
"He has been a massive influence and it'll be good to see him on Sunday. There's a bit of competition and we'll see how it goes!" Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
